meta.description: Examples of the data contained at the page level of the XSLT framework.

content.p: TakahÄ“ stores the content for individual pages in files. These act in much the same way as pages would, in a static site: the folders these files are placed in, dictate the final of the page they represent.
Each content file included a content block, which is marked up as follows:

pre.code: This is the content for the page

content.p: can be added directly inside the content tag, but as it will be treated as , all tags should be well-formed.
Much of the meta-data which is used in global.xml can be reused at the page level. This means that a site might be in one language, but an individual page could be set to a different language.
Meta elements, which can be set at the page level:

ul.li: Page title (if left empty, this string will be taken from the navigation in global.xml)
Page URL - string from the root of the site. It should match that used in global.xml (required).
